info.title: JSON-RPC API
info.description: This section provides an interactive reference for MetaMask's Wallet JSON-RPC API. The API builds on a set of standard Ethereum methods with MetaMask-specific enhancements, and is designed for seamless integration into dapps.

methods.name: wallet_addEthereumChain
methods.summary: Adds an Ethereum chain to the wallet.
methods.description: Creates a confirmation asking the user to add the specified chain to the wallet application. The caller must specify a chain ID and some chain metadata. Specified by [EIP-3085](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3085).

errors.message: Expected null or array with at least one valid string HTTPS URL 'blockExplorerUrl'. Received: ${blockExplorerUrls}

Expected 0x-prefixed, unpadded, non-zero hexadecimal string 'chainId'. Received:
${chainId}

Invalid chain ID "${_chainId}": numerical value greater than max safe value. Received:
${chainId}
May not specify default MetaMask chain.

Expected 2-6 character string 'nativeCurrency.symbol'. Received:
${ticker}

nativeCurrency.symbol does not match currency symbol for a network the user already has added with the same chainId. Received:
${ticker}

result.name: Null response
result.description: This method returns `null` if the chain is added.

methods.name: wallet_switchEthereumChain
methods.summary: Switches the wallet's active Ethereum chain.
methods.description: Requests that the wallet switches its active Ethereum chain. Specified by [EIP-3326](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3326).

schema.title: Chain
schema.description: Object containing the chain ID to switch to.

chainId.description: The chain ID as a `0x`-prefixed hexadecimal string, as returned by the `eth_chainId` method.

result.name: Null response
result.description: This method returns `null` if the active chain is switched.

errors.message: Unrecognized chain ID. Try adding the chain using wallet_addEthereumChain first.

methods.name: wallet_getPermissions
methods.summary: Gets the user's permissions.
methods.description: Gets the user's permissions. Specified by [EIP-2255](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2255).

methods.name: wallet_requestPermissions
methods.summary: Requests additional permissions.
methods.description: This method requests additional permissions from the user. This method accepts a single permission per call. Specified by [EIP-2255](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2255).

schema.title: Permission
schema.description: Object containing the permission to request.

^\\S+$.description: The permission object. The property name is the permission identifier (e.g., 'eth_accounts', 'endowment:xyz').

methods.name: wallet_revokePermissions
methods.summary: Revokes the current dapp permissions.
methods.description: Revokes previously granted permissions for the current dapp identified by its origin. This method accepts a single permission per call. Specified by [MIP-2](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/MIPs/mip-2.md) and only available for the MetaMask browser extension.

schema.title: Permission
schema.description: Object containing the permission to revoke.

^\\S+$.description: The permission object. The property name is the permission identifier (e.g., 'eth_accounts', 'endowment:xyz').

result.name: Null response
result.description: This method returns `null` if the permission is revoked.

methods.name: personal_sign
methods.summary: Presents a plain text signature challenge to the user.
methods.description:
Presents a plain text signature challenge to the user and returns the signed response. Prepends a safe prefix to the signed message to prevent the challenge tricking users into signing a financial transaction.

MetaMask implements `personal_sign` similarly to the Go Ethereum client's `eth_sign` implementation. MetaMask's `personal_sign` doesn't accept a password.

This method requires that the user has granted permission to interact with their account first, so make sure to call `eth_requestAccounts` (recommended) or `wallet_requestPermissions` first.

params.name: Challenge
params.description: A hex-encoded UTF-8 string to present to the user. See how to encode a string like this in the [`browser-string-hexer`](https://github.com/danfinlay/browser-string-hexer) module.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the requested signing account.

methods.name: eth_signTypedData_v4
methods.summary: Presents a structured data message for the user to sign.
methods.description: Presents a data message for the user to sign in a structured and readable format and returns the signed response. Introduced by [EIP-712](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-712). This method requires that the user has granted permission to interact with their account first, so make sure to call `eth_requestAccounts` (recommended) or `wallet_requestPermissions` first.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the requested signing account.

methods.name: wallet_registerOnboarding
methods.summary: Redirects the user back to the site after onboarding.
methods.description: Registers the requesting site with MetaMask as the initiator of onboarding, enabling MetaMask to redirect the user back to the site after onboarding. Returns a promise that resolves to `true`, or rejects the request if there's an error. Instead of calling this method directly, you should use the [`@metamask/onboarding`](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-onboarding) library.

result.name: Registered
result.description: `true` if the request was successful, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: wallet_watchAsset
methods.summary: Tracks a token in MetaMask.
methods.description: Requests that the user track the specified token in MetaMask. Returns a boolean indicating if the token was successfully added. Once added, the token is indistinguishable from those added using legacy methods, such as a centralized registry. Introduced by [EIP-747](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-747).

schema.description: The token type (`ERC20`, `ERC721`, or `ERC1155`). Support for ERC-721 and ERC-1155 tokens is experimental and currently only available on the extension (not on mobile). See [MIP-1](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/MIPs/mip-1.md) and the [MIP proposal lifecycle](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-improvement-proposals/blob/main/PROCESS-GUIDE.md#proposal-lifecycle) for more information.
An object containing information about the token.

address.description: The address of the token contract.

symbol.description: A ticker symbol or shorthand, up to 11 characters (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

decimals.description: The number of token decimals (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

image.description: A string URL of the token logo (optional for ERC-20 tokens).

tokenId.description: The unique identifier of the NFT (required for ERC-721 and ERC-1155 tokens).

errors.message: Must specify address, symbol, and decimals.
Invalid symbol: not a string.
Invalid symbol '${symbol}': longer than 11 characters.
Invalid decimals '${decimals}': must be 0 <= 36.
Invalid address '${address}'.
Asset type is required.
Both address and tokenId are required.
Invalid address.
Suggested NFT is not owned by the selected account.
Suggested NFT of type ${standard} does not match received type ${type}.
Unable to verify ownership. Possibly because the standard is not supported or the user's currently selected network does not match the chain of the asset in question.

result.name: Added
result.description: `true` if the token was added, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: wallet_scanQRCode
methods.summary: Requests that the user scan a QR code.
methods.description: Requests that the user scan a QR code using their device camera. Introduced by [EIP-945](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/945).

params.name: Regex
params.description: A regular expression (regex) string for matching arbitrary QR code strings.

result.name: QR code string
result.description: A string corresponding to the scanned QR code. If a regex string is provided, the resulting string matches it. If no regex string is provided, the resulting string matches an Ethereum address. If neither condition is met, the method returns an error.

methods.name: wallet_sendCalls
methods.summary: Sends a batch of calls.
methods.description: Requests that the wallet submits a batch of calls. Specified by [EIP-5792](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5792).

schema.description: An object containing information about the sent batch.

id.description: The ID of the batch of calls.

capabilities.description: Wallets can use this object to attach capability-specific metadata.

errors.message: Version not supported.
The wallet does not support a capability that was not marked as optional.
EIP-7702 not supported on the specified chain ID.
There is already a batch submitted with the specified batch ID.
The batch is too large for the wallet to process.
EIP-7702 upgrade rejected for this chain and account.

methods.name: wallet_getCallsStatus
methods.summary: Gets the status of a call batch.
methods.description: Gets the status of a batch of calls that was previously sent using `wallet_sendCalls`. Specified by [EIP-5792](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5792).

params.name: Batch ID
params.description: The ID of a batch of calls (the `id` value returned by `wallet_sendCalls`).

schema.description: An object containing status information of the batch of calls.

version.description: The version of the API format.

id.description: The ID of the batch of calls.

chainId.description: The chain ID of the calls.

status.description:
The status code of the batch of calls. Possible values are:
  • `100` - Pending
  • `200` - Confirmed
  • `400` - Failed offchain
  • `500` - Reverted
  • `600` - Partially reverted

atomic.description: `true` if the wallet executed the calls atomically. `false` if the wallet executed the calls non-atomically.

receipts.description: An array of transaction receipts. If the wallet executed the calls atomically, a single receipt or an array of receipts may be returned, corresponding to how the batch of calls were included onchain.

items.title: Log
items.description: An object containing information about the log.

address.description: The address that generated the log.

status.description: The status of the transaction. `0x1` indicates success, and `0x0` indicates failure.

blockHash.description: The hash of the block containing the transaction.

blockNumber.description: The number of the block containing the transaction.

gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used by the transaction.

capabilities.description: Capabilities associated with the batch of calls.

errors.message: No matching bundle found.

methods.name: wallet_getCapabilities
methods.summary: Gets the capabilities of the wallet.
methods.description: Returns information about the wallet's support for the `atomic` capability. The `atomic` capability specifies how the wallet will execute batches of transactions sent using `wallet_sendCalls`. `wallet_getCapabilities` is specified by [EIP-5792](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5792).

params.name: Chain IDs
params.description: An array of chain IDs to get capabilities for.

items.title: Chain ID
items.description: An [EIP-155](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-155) chain ID in hexadecimal format.

schema.description:
An object specifying the status of the `atomic` capability for specific [EIP-155](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-155) chain IDs. For each chain, the `atomic` capability can have a `status` of:
  • `supported` - The wallet will execute calls sent using `wallet_sendCalls` atomically.
  • `ready` - The wallet can upgrade to `supported` pending user approval to upgrade their account via EIP-7702.
If the `atomic` capability is not `supported` or `ready` for a specified chain ID, the wallet will not return anything for that chain ID.

methods.name: eth_requestAccounts
methods.description: Requests that the user provide access to one or more Ethereum addresses. This method is specified by [EIP-1102](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1102). Internally, this method calls `wallet_requestPermissions` for permission to call `eth_accounts`.
methods.summary: Requests that the user provide access to addresses.

schema.description: An array of Ethereum addresses that the user has authorized the dapp to access.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.description: Returns a list of addresses that the user has authorized the dapp to access. This method requires calling `wallet_requestPermissions` for permission. We recommend using `eth_requestAccounts`, which internally calls `wallet_requestPermission`.
methods.summary: Gets a list of authorized addresses.

schema.description: An array of Ethereum addresses that the user has authorized the dapp to access.

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.description: Creates a new wallet confirmation to make an Ethereum transaction from the user's account. This method requires that the user has granted permission to interact with their account first, so make sure to call `eth_requestAccounts` (recommended) or `wallet_requestPermissions` first.
methods.summary: Initiates a new transaction.

params.name: Transaction
params.description: The transaction object to sign and send.

schema.title: Transaction
schema.description: The parameters to customize a transaction. If a `to` address is not provided, the transaction is assumed to be a contract creation transaction, and the `data` field is used as the contract initialization code. `gasPrice` cannot be used together with `maxPriorityFeePerGas` and `maxFeePerGas`.

gas.description: The maximum amount of gas the transaction is allowed to use.

value.description: The amount to transfer in wei.

data.description: The data to include in the transaction. Used for contract creation transactions.

gasPrice.description: The gas price the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei. Used in pre-1559 transactions.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei. Used in 1559 transactions.

maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei. Used in 1559 transactions.

result.name: Transaction hash
result.description: The transaction hash of the sent transaction.

errors.message: The requested account and/or method has not been authorized by the user.

methods.name: eth_decrypt
methods.summary: Decrypts an encrypted message.
methods.description:
This method is deprecated and may be removed in the future.

 Requests that MetaMask decrypt the specified encrypted message.
 The message must have been encrypted using the public encryption key of the specified Ethereum address.
 Returns a promise that resolves to the decrypted message, or rejects if the decryption attempt fails.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the Ethereum account that can decrypt the message.

errors.message: The requested account and/or method has not been authorized by the user.

methods.name: eth_getEncryptionPublicKey
methods.summary: Gets a public key used for encryption.
methods.description:
This method is deprecated and may be removed in the future.

 Requests that the user share their public encryption key.
 Returns a public encryption key, or rejects if the user denies the request.
 The public key is computed from entropy associated with the specified user account, using the NaCl implementation of the `X25519_XSalsa20_Poly1305` algorithm.

params.name: Address
params.description: The address of the Ethereum account that can decrypt the message.

methods.name: web3_clientVersion
methods.description: Returns the current MetaMask client version. This differs slightly per client. For example, the browser extension returns a string like `MetaMask/v10.33.1`, while the mobile app returns a string like `MetaMask/8.1.2/Mobile`.
methods.summary: Current client version.

examples.name: MetaMaskMobileClientVersionExample
examples.description: Example version response from MetaMask Mobile.

methods.name: eth_subscribe
methods.summary: Subscribes to specific Ethereum events, returning a subscription ID used to receive notifications.
methods.description: Subscribes to specific events on the Ethereum network, such as new blocks, or logs. When an event occurs, a notification is sent to the client with the corresponding data. To stop receiving notifications, the client can unsubscribe using `eth_unsubscribe`.

schema.title: subscriptionType
schema.description:
The type of subscription to create. Must be one of the following:
1. `newHeads` - New block headers.
2. `logs` - Logs matching a filter object.

schema.title: filterOptions
schema.description: (Optional) An object containing filter options specific to the subscription type. Only applicable for the `logs` subscription type.

address.description: (Optional) A single address or an array of addresses to filter the logs by.

topics.description: An array of topics to filter the logs by.

result.name: subscriptionId
result.description: A unique subscription ID that can be used to unsubscribe or identify incoming notifications.

methods.name: eth_unsubscribe
methods.summary: Unsubscribes from a specific Ethereum event, using the subscription ID provided by `eth_subscribe`.
methods.description: Unsubscribes from specific events on the Ethereum network, to which the client has been previously subscribed using `eth_subscribe`. The client must provide the subscription ID obtained from `eth_subscribe` to stop receiving notifications for the corresponding event.

schema.description: The unique subscription ID obtained from `eth_subscribe`, used to identify the subscription to be unsubscribed.

result.name: unsubscribed
result.description: A boolean value indicating whether the unsubscription was successful.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: Returns the chain ID of the current network.

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Returns the client coinbase address.

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

methods.name: eth_feeHistory
methods.summary: Transaction fee history
methods.description: Returns transaction base fee per gas and effective priority fee per gas for the requested/supported block range.

params.name: blockCount
params.description: Requested range of blocks. Clients will return less than the requested range if not all blocks are available.

params.name: newestBlock
params.description: Highest block of the requested range.

params.name: rewardPercentiles
params.description: A monotonically increasing list of percentile values. For each block in the requested range, the transactions will be sorted in ascending order by effective tip per gas and the coresponding effective tip for the percentile will be determined, accounting for gas consumed.

result.name: Fee history result
result.description: Fee history for the returned block range. This can be a subsection of the requested range if not all blocks are available.

oldestBlock.title: oldestBlock
oldestBlock.description: Lowest number block of returned range.

baseFeePerGas.title: baseFeePerGasArray
baseFeePerGas.description: An array of block base fees per gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-1559 blocks.

baseFeePerBlobGas.title: baseFeePerBlobGasArray
baseFeePerBlobGas.description: An array of block base fees per blob gas. This includes the next block after the newest of the returned range, because this value can be derived from the newest block. Zeroes are returned for pre-EIP-4844 blocks.

gasUsedRatio.title: gasUsedRatio
gasUsedRatio.description: An array of block gas used ratios. These are calculated as the ratio of gasUsed and gasLimit.

blobGasUsedRatio.title: blobGasUsedRatio
blobGasUsedRatio.description: An array of block blob gas used ratios. These are calculated as the ratio of blobGasUsed and the max blob gas per block.

reward.title: rewardArray
reward.description: A two-dimensional array of effective priority fees per gas at the requested block percentiles.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: An array of effective priority fee per gas data points from a single block. All zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

items.title: rewardPercentile
items.description: A given percentile sample of effective priority fees per gas from a single block in ascending order, weighted by gas used. Zeroes are returned if the block is empty.

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei.

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary: Returns the balance of the account of given address.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Returns information about a block by number.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: Returns code at a given address.

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary: Polling method for the filter with the given ID (created using `eth_newFilter`). Returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching the filter with the given ID (created using `eth_newFilter`).

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching the specified filter.

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.summary: Returns the merkle proof for a given account and optionally some storage keys.

methods.name: eth_getStorageAt
methods.summary: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a transaction by block number and transaction index position.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByHash
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionCount
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives.

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Submits a raw transaction. You can create and sign a transaction externally using a library such as [web3.js](https://web3js.readthedocs.io/) or [ethers.js](https://docs.ethers.org/). For [EIP-4844](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4844) transactions, the raw form must be the network form. This means it includes the blobs, KZG commitments, and KZG proofs.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary: Uninstalls a filter with given id.

InvalidParams.message: The wallet cannot parse the request.

Unauthorized.message: The requested account and/or method has not been authorized by the user.

TypedData.title: Typed data
TypedData.description: Object containing information about the typed data to sign.

items.title: Domain separator value
items.description: Object containing information about the domain separator value.

name.description: Name of the domain separator value.

type.description: Data type of the domain separator value.

EIP712Domain.description:
An array specifying one or more of the following domain separator values:

  • `name` - The user-readable name of the signing domain, that is, the name of the dapp or the protocol.
  • `version` - The current major version of the signing domain.
  • `chainId` - The chain ID of the network.
  • `verifyingContract` - The address of the contract that will verify the signature.
  • `salt` - A disambiguating salt for the protocol.

domain.description: Object containing the domain separator values specified in the `EIP712Domain` type.

primaryType.description: The primary type of the message.

message.description: The message you're proposing the user to sign.

SendCallsParameter.title: Calls
SendCallsParameter.description: An object containing information about a batch of calls.

version.description: The version of the API format. This must be `2.0.0`.

id.description: The ID of the batch of calls.

chainId.description: The [EIP-155](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-155) chain ID of the calls. This must match the currently selected network in the wallet.

atomicRequired.description: `true` if the wallet must execute all calls atomically. If `false`, the wallet may execute the calls sequentially without atomicity. If `false` and the wallet is capable of executing the calls atomically, it may do so.

items.title: Call
items.description: An object containing information about the call.

to.description: The address of the call's recipient.

data.description: The data to send with the call.

value.description: The value to send with the call.

capabilities.description: Dapps can use this object to communicate with the wallet about supported capabilities.
Dapps can use this object to communicate with the wallet about supported capabilities.

AddEthereumChainParameter.title: Chain
AddEthereumChainParameter.description: Object containing information about the chain to add.

chainId.description: The chain ID as a `0x`-prefixed hexadecimal string, per the `eth_chainId` method. MetaMask compares this chain ID value with the `eth_chainId` return value. If these values aren't identical, MetaMask rejects the request.

blockExplorerUrls.description: (Optional) An array of one or more URLs pointing to block explorer sites for the chain.

chainName.description: A human-readable name for the chain.

iconUrls.description: (Optional) An array of one or more URLs pointing to icons that can be used to visually identify the chain. Note: MetaMask will not currently display these icons. You can still include icon URLs so they are used if MetaMask incorporates them into the display of custom networks in the future.

rpcUrls.description: An array of one or more URLs pointing to RPC endpoints that can be used to communicate with the chain. At least one item is required, and only the first item is used.

NativeCurrency.title: NativeCurrency
NativeCurrency.description: An object containing information about the native currency of the chain.

decimals.description: A non-negative integer representing the number of decimals the native currency uses.

name.description: A human-readable name of the native currency.

symbol.description: A human-readable symbol of the native currency.

Caveats.title: Caveats
Caveats.description: An array of caveats that specify restrictions on the permission.

items.title: Caveat
items.description: Object containing information about the caveat.

Permission.title: Permission
Permission.description: Object containing information about the permission.

parentCapability.description: The name of the permission being granted. For example, `eth_accounts` or `endowment:permitted-chains`.

invoker.description: The URI of the dapp being granted this permission.

date.description: The timestamp of the permission request.

PermissionsList.title: Permissions list
PermissionsList.description: An array of the user's permissions.

BlockTag.title: Block tag
BlockTag.description: `earliest`: The lowest numbered block the client has available; `finalized`: The most recent crypto-economically secure block, cannot be re-orged outside of manual intervention driven by community coordination; `safe`: The most recent block that is safe from re-orgs under honest majority and certain synchronicity assumptions; `latest`: The most recent block in the canonical chain observed by the client, this block may be re-orged out of the canonical chain even under healthy/normal conditions; `pending`: A sample next block built by the client on top of `latest` and containing the set of transactions usually taken from local mempool. Before the merge transition is finalized, any call querying for `finalized` or `safe` block MUST be responded to with `-39001: Unknown block` error

BlockNumberOrTagOrHash.title: Block number, tag, or block hash

oneOf.title: Not syncing
oneOf.description: Should always return false if not syncing.

to.title: to
to.description: Address of the receiver or null in a contract creation transaction.

cumulativeGasUsed.title: cumulative gas used
cumulativeGasUsed.description: The sum of gas used by this transaction and all preceding transactions in the same block.

gasUsed.title: gas used
gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used for this specific transaction alone.

blobGasUsed.title: blob gas used
blobGasUsed.description: The amount of blob gas used for this specific transaction. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

contractAddress.title: contract address
contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null.

root.title: state root
root.description: The post-transaction state root. Only specified for transactions included before the Byzantium upgrade.

status.title: status
status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure). Only specified for transactions included after the Byzantium upgrade.

effectiveGasPrice.title: effective gas price
effectiveGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account. Before EIP-1559, this is equal to the transaction's gas price. After, it is equal to baseFeePerGas + min(maxFeePerGas - baseFeePerGas, maxPriorityFeePerGas).

blobGasPrice.title: blob gas price
blobGasPrice.description: The actual value per gas deducted from the sender's account for blob gas. Only specified for blob transactions as defined by EIP-4844.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

maxFeePerBlobGas.title: max fee per blob gas
maxFeePerBlobGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay for blob gas in wei

blobVersionedHashes.title: blobVersionedHashes
blobVersionedHashes.description: List of versioned blob hashes associated with the transaction's EIP-4844 data blobs.

chainId.title: chainId
chainId.description: Chain ID that this transaction is valid on.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.title: max priority fee per gas
maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: Maximum fee per gas the sender is willing to pay to miners in wei

maxFeePerGas.title: max fee per gas
maxFeePerGas.description: The maximum total fee per gas the sender is willing to pay (includes the network / base fee and miner / priority fee) in wei

gasPrice.title: gas price
gasPrice.description: The effective gas price paid by the sender in wei. For transactions not yet included in a block, this value should be set equal to the max fee per gas. This field is DEPRECATED, please transition to using effectiveGasPrice in the receipt object going forward.

v.title: v
